private_information: I am responsible for executing and reporting a subset of the move actions in the sequence assigned to Agent Alpha.
I can observe the blocks that are involved in my assigned actions and I can report state changes after each action.
agent_alpha.goal: Execute assigned block manipulation actions and report the resulting state transitions so the orchestrator can build a final plan representation.

private_information: I am responsible for executing and reporting the complementary subset of move actions in the sequence assigned to Agent Beta.
I can observe the blocks that are involved in my assigned actions and I can report state changes after each action.
agent_beta.goal: Execute assigned block manipulation actions and report the resulting state transitions so the orchestrator can build a final plan representation.

private_information: I will integrate the reports from agent_alpha and agent_beta and produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards.
I must keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the PDDL model when relevant.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent reports and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the final state after the given action sequence.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with the constraint that only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
The blocks present are A B C D E F G H I J K.
Initial arrangement: A is on top of C.
Initial arrangement: B is on the table.
Initial arrangement: C is on top of K.
Initial arrangement: D is on top of E.
Initial arrangement: E is on the table.
Initial arrangement: F is on the table.
Initial arrangement: G is on top of B.
Initial arrangement: H is on top of G.
Initial arrangement: I is on top of J.
Initial arrangement: J is on top of F.
Initial arrangement: K is on the table.
A sequence of 30 actions will be executed in the given order. Each action is one of unstack, putdown, pickup or stack and follows Blocks World semantics.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that executes an assigned subset of block manipulation actions. You do not emit PDDL. After performing each assigned action produce a concise structured report of the state change focusing on which block moved from where to where and which blocks became exposed or covered. Use the public information and your private information to determine state transitions.
report.prompt: Your name is agent_alpha. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->agent_alpha->private_information} This is your local goal: {agents->agent_alpha->goal} You have been assigned a subset of the action sequence to execute and report. Execute your assigned actions and output a structured list of state changes after each action. Do not output PDDL. If you lack information about an action, report the ambiguity explicitly.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that executes an assigned subset of block manipulation actions. You do not emit PDDL. After performing each assigned action produce a concise structured report of the state change focusing on which block moved from where to where and which blocks became exposed or covered. Use the public information and your private information to determine state transitions.
report.prompt: Your name is agent_beta. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->agent_beta->private_information} This is your local goal: {agents->agent_beta->goal} You have been assigned the complementary subset of the action sequence to execute and report. Execute your assigned actions and output a structured list of state changes after each action. Do not output PDDL. If you lack information about an action, report the ambiguity explicitly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Your task is to integrate agent reports and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Model standard Blocks World predicates and actions so they are compatible with FastDownwards. Keep agent actions distinct if they represent different actors, but produce a combined planning problem that yields the final state after the full action sequence.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive structured reports from two agents that executed a 30-step action sequence on Blocks World. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and the agents' reports: {agent_alpha_report} and {agent_beta_report} and integrate them to produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to FastDownwards. The PDDL must model Blocks World semantics including only-top block moves and single block carrying. Represent the initial state inferred from the public information and the final state after applying the full action sequence. Keep actions of agent_alpha and agent_beta distinct where appropriate. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Do not include commentary outside the tags.
